oracle.nosql.driver.idcs

Class AccessTokenProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.nosql.driver.idcs.AccessTokenProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthorizationProvider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultAccessTokenProvider

    public abstract class AccessTokenProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements AuthorizationProvider
    AccessTokenProvider is an implemtnation of AuthorizationProvider that uses access tokens (ATs) obtained from the Oracle Identity Cloud Service (IDCS) as authorization information.

    An instance of this class is supplied to the driver via NoSQLHandleConfig.setAuthorizationProvider(oracle.nosql.driver.AuthorizationProvider).

    This class caches access tokens acquired to minimize external calls. The callback provider is invoked if the AT is evicted from cache.

    It should not be necessary for applications to implement this interface. The mechanisms for dealing with IDCS are relatively complex and the DefaultAccessTokenProvider is sufficient for most needs.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ANDC_AUD_PREFIX
      This string is used as prefix of the audience of an OAuth resource.The full audience is urn:opc:andc:entitlementid={ENTITLEMENT_ID}, the ENTITLEMENT_ID is dynamically generated by Oracle Cloud.
      static java.lang.String SCOPE
      There is currently has only one fixed OAuth scope, which can be used in the AT acquisition to build the fully qualified scope along with audience.

    • Method Detail

      • getAccountAccessToken

        public abstract java.lang.String getAccountAccessToken()
                                                throws RequestTimeoutException
        Returns an account AT to be used for one of the following operations:
        1. Create table
        2. Drop table
        3. Alter table limits
        4. List tables

        Oracle Cloud creates an OAuth resource named "PSMApp-cacct-{id}" when the cloud account is created. Note that id will be dynamically generated for each account by Oracle Cloud. This method must return an AT with audience in the account OAuth resource, and scope /paas/core/api/*. Note that currently this OAuth resource only allows Resource Owner Grant type to acquire the access token. In other words, the client id and secret pair along with user name and password need to be present in the token acquisition payload.

        Returns:
        an account access token.
        Throws:
        RequestTimeoutException - if token acquisition does not complete within the configured timeout interval.

      • getServiceAccessToken

        public abstract java.lang.String getServiceAccessToken()
                                                throws RequestTimeoutException
        Returns an AT to be used for service operations which is all data operations and generally any operation that is not an account operations.
        Returns:
        a service access token.
        Throws:
        RequestTimeoutException - if token acquisition does not complete within the configured timeout interval.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
